trait.name: Jumper
entries: The lamp cat's jump distance is determined using its Dexterity rather than its Strength.

trait.name: Angler Lamp
entries: Bright light created by the lure of the lamp cat overrides magic darkness and creatures within the light can't benefit from the {@condition invisible} condition and insight checks against them have advantage.

trait.name: Cats Playing Chess?
entries: Lamp Cat's add twice their proficiency bonus and treat their intelligence as 18 when making a gaming tools check made to play chess. ("Meow", *takes your bishop for mate.)

bonus.name: Lure
entries: The lamp cat may enable or disable its lure. While enabled the Lamp Cat sheds 5 feet of bright light and another 5 feet of dim light.

reaction.name: Flash
entries: {@actTrigger} The Lamp Cat uses its Lure bonus action. {@actResponse} The Lamp Cat chooses one creature that is Medium or smaller with eyes that can see the Lamp Cat. It gains one of the following affects:
*The creature has disadvantage on it's next {@dice D20} check.
If the target is Tiny or has less than 5 hp, the creature instead gains both affects and looses 15 ft of movement on it's next turn.
Once the Lamp Cat uses this feature, it cannot do so again until it completes a long rest.
